intro: Blepharis torrei, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers, which bloom in the spring, are usually pale blue or purple and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Blepharis torrei is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
